solution.text:
Initial principal (P) = Rs. _{{j*5000}}_
Time Period (T) = 2 years
Annual interest rate(R) = 10%
Since, it is compounded half yearly, \( A = P \times (1+\frac{R}{200})^{2T} \)
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, amount in bank = \(_{{j*5000}}_ \times (1+ \frac{10}{200})^4 \) = Rs._{{Decimal('6077.531')*j}}_

content.text: Find the amount of money in a bank account after 2 years, if the initial principal was Rs. _{{5000*j}}_ and interest rate was 10% annually, compounded half yearly.
